keyword: calories in a tuna subway sandwich
title: Calories in a Tuna Subway Sandwich
meta_description: Discover calories in a tuna subway sandwich, including macros like protein and fat, plus tweaks and FAQs for Subway's 6-inch tuna sub.
h1: Calories in a Tuna Subway Sandwich
assumptions: 6-inch Subway Tuna sub on white bread with tuna salad (mayo-based), lettuce, tomatoes, onions, cucumbers, bell peppers; no cheese or extra sauces.
disclaimer: Nutrition varies by location, customizations, bread type, portion size, and exact ingredients. Check Subway's app or nutrition guide for latest values.

quick_answer.text: A standard 6-inch Tuna Subway sandwich provides ~480 kcal and ~20 g protein.

label_note: Totals mirror Nutrition Facts fields for easy comparison.

faqs.q: How many calories in a 6-inch tuna Subway sandwich?
faqs.a: Approximately 480 kcal for a standard 6-inch tuna sub with veggies.

faqs.q: What's the protein in a tuna Subway sandwich?
faqs.a: About 20 g protein per 6-inch sandwich, mainly from the tuna.

faqs.q: Does a tuna Subway sandwich have a lot of sodium?
faqs.a: Yes, around 850 mg due to the tuna salad and breadâ€”watch if on a low-sodium diet.

faqs.q: Calories in a footlong tuna Subway sandwich?
faqs.a: Roughly double, about 960 kcal for a footlong version.

faqs.q: How to lower calories in a tuna Subway sandwich?
faqs.a: Opt for no mayo, extra veggies, whole wheat bread, or a smaller size to reduce by 50-100 kcal.
